subject: AI & Agents
title: GANs: Generator vs Discriminator
description: A quick win: understand GANs: Generator vs Discriminator.

hook.text: One network makes fake images. Another tries to spot them. Both get better.

buildup.text: GANs pit a generator (creates images) against a discriminator (detects fakes).

discovery.text: Training ends when the discriminator can't tell real from fakeâ€”the generator wins.

twist.text: GANs are notoriously hard to train: mode collapse, instability, and hyperparameter sensitivity.

climax.text: StyleGAN generates photorealistic faces of people who don't exist.

quiz.question: What is mode collapse in GANs?
options: The generator produces only a few similar outputs
